text.div:
NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
Extension 0..*ExtensionObligation
extension:code 1..1ExtensionThe obligation that applies
extension 0..0
url 1..1uri"code"
value[x] 1..1codeValue of extension
Binding: Obligation Codes ValueSet (required)
extension:elementId 0..*ExtensionWhen the obligation is on the profile itself, not a particular element, a list of elements to which it applies
extension 0..0
url 1..1uri"elementId"
value[x] 1..1stringValue of extension
extension:actorId 1..1ExtensionThe actor to which this obligation applies. If no actor is specified, then the obligation applies to all implementations
extension 0..0
url 1..1uri"actorId"
value[x] 1..1uriValue of extension
extension:documentation 0..1ExtensionDocumentation about this particular obligation
extension 0..0
url 1..1uri"documentation"
value[x] 1..1markdownValue of extension
extension:usage 0..1ExtensionIndicates a particular context where the usage applies. Expected use: limiting obligations to particular jurisdictions (e.g. in IPS)
extension 0..0
url 1..1uri"usage"
value[x] 1..1UsageContextValue of extension
extension:filter 0..1ExtensionA FHIRPath expression that indicates which repeats in the list of elements this obligation applies to
extension 0..0
url 1..1uri"filter"
value[x] 1..1stringValue of extension
extension:filter-desc 0..1ExtensionA description of which repeats in the list of elements this obligation applies to
extension 0..0
url 1..1uri"filter-desc"
value[x] 1..1stringValue of extension
extension:process 0..1ExtensionIndicates a specific process scope for this obligation (not fully specified yet, won't be support, just marking the space)
extension 0..0
url 1..1uri"filter"
value[x] 1..1codeValue of extension
url 1..1uri"http://hl7.org/fhir/tools/StructureDefinition/obligation"
value[x] 0..0

Documentation for this format

element.definition: Obligations applied to bindable elements.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: An Extension

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.definition: An Extension

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: identifies the meaning of the extension
element.definition: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.
element.comment: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition SHALL be a URI for the Structure Definition defining the extension.

element.definition: Value of extension - must be one of a constrained set of the data types (see [Extensibility](http://hl7.org/fhir/R5/extensibility.html) for a list).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: When the obligation is on the profile itself, not a particular element, a list of elements to which it applies
